intro: Apatelantha, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of a single species, Apatelantha glabrata, native to South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in winter. It has a succulent, shrub-like appearance with thick, fleshy leaves. Apatelantha is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
